name: quiet clearing in lithuanian forest.
description: acesses by a dirt track from the road, when nearing the coordinates, you will se a few tracks, follow them and you will reach a nice clearing. I doubt anything bigger than a 4x4 would fit down the forest tracks though!

name: Downtown forest
description: Hostel with small camping space. Best for tents but there is a limited amount of space for small campers, book in advance. Fantastic location but the bar is big and busy and noisy so be prepared!

name: Lake near Kavarskas
description: small place at the end of the dam marked with white poles. good fishing. place for 3 small vans or 1 big rig.

name: Lake Rubikiu Ezeras
description: This is one of the many free camping and picknick spots around this lake. Mostly  wth primitive wc, tables and fire place. some have space for bigger rigs, this one suits only smaller cars.

name: Ferry to neringa
description: Ferry to neringa. We paid €19 euro for a t5 campervan. It's a return ticket Although we used only one way.

name: Beautiful Paddock
description: Two big baddocks, surrounded by trees, near a small stream. One long drop toilet, fireplace, seating benches. Apparently, the place is being maintained by somebody. At the time we visited, we were the only ones there and nobody came around to collect money. Can't guarantee this is a free site, though.

name: Perlojos
description:
There are a couple of camping spots around the lake. At the coordinates specified, there is one supposedly free site, which was taken when we arrived. 

Next to it, there are two lots, also adjacent to the lake, with phone numbers you're supposed to call when you intend to stay overnight. The phone number didn't work, however, a lady came around to collect 3€ for the night. Nice place overall, but kind of extreme with mosquitoes.

Access is via a bumpy dirt/Forest road from Ziurai (turn left into the forest road at the first hamlet after Ziurai)  or a slightly better one from Mergezeris (just turn into the next best forest road when you're just east of the place).

name: Puvočių
description: This is a paid site. There are many lots surrounded by trees and also a large free area. Wooden shelters as well as fireplaces are available. There is a river with a small sand beach nearby. There are long drop toilets. Price was (2017) €1,50 per vehicle, 1€ per person and 1€ per tent. Children are free. The friendly owner(?) comes by at some point to collect the fees. We didn't pay anything. The place was for free (2020)

name: Scenic Camping Spot By The River
description: Scenic camping spot in a beautiful pine forest next to a river bend. A bit littered, though. There is a main spot with a shelter and fireplace and a small beach, which is frequented by locals. There are more spots down the path, which are more quiet. Access is by a forest road which turns off from the main road west of the place.

name: Kerocio
description: There are multiple spots to camp around this small lake surrounded by forest. Beware of party people on summer weekends.

name: Pakasas lake wild camp
description: From village Seiminiskes entry through off-road pathway

name: Ginuciai tent camp
description: Nice place with wooden tables benches sheds anr firewoods.

name: Sunny Nights camping
description:
Welcome to Sunny Nights Camping ! :)

The Sunny Nights camping is perfectly situated on the E77/A12 road going from Šiauliai to Riga. While being here, you can visit the famous Hill of Crosses which is 19 km away, the Jakiškės manor, an old wooden chapel or the Žagarės Regional park, which are also close by.

The camp site is the perfect place to relax and have a good time :)

In our camp site, you’ll appreciate a picnic in our old apple garden, have a nice barbecue on the outdoor grill or cook in a well-furnished kitchen. Then, you’ll get some rest in the guest room or on the terrace while using the free wifi, you will meet nice people and enjoy coffee, tea and some sweets. Others activities you can do in here are : swimming in the lovely pond attached to our garden or even better, enjoying the traditional sauna (with additional fees).

For the more adventurous, we offer bikes to rent so you can explore around; there are special paths & routes or you can cycle along village roads wherever you like.

If you don’t like to camp, maybe you’ll prefer to stay in our comfortable beds in a unique 100 years old house, check our hostel accommodation options ! ;)

Last but not the least, you'll be friendly welcomed in this camping where you can try handmade apple cider !

GPS: N56.156733, E23.533478
Address: Rygos street 12A, Gataučiai,
Joniškis distr., Lithuania, E77/A12 Road
E-mail: sunnynightscamping@gmail.com
☏ +370 626 06735

Note - access by normal 3.5 tonne motorhomes is fine, but suggest larger or heavier vehicles should make contact first to check

name: Free Place To Camp
description: A bit uninspiring place, but free nevertheless.

name: Almajo
description: This place is a gem. Located in a beautiful forest right next to a lake. There are numerous spots to camp, with benches, fireplaces and pit toilets provided. Also, there are wooden docks for swimming. Overall, this site is very well maintained. We paid €6 per night for an adult and a child, a car and a tent.

name: Lakajos Ezero
description:
Beautiful site on a small peninsula in a lake, covered by forest. Nice and quiet. Long drop toilets were ... full at the time we visited, so bring a shovel.

Access is by a narrow, winding path with protruding tree roots. It's doable for normal cars with decent clearance, but lowered vehicles and bigger rigs might struggle.

name: Baidaremis
description: Camp site on a paddock with old apple trees. Provides a shelter, fireplace and long drop toilet. There's a small stream running across the property. There's a sign with a teleplone number written on it that you're supposed to call when you intend to stay. The guy doesn't speak any English, so we texted him an Google-translated message, which worked well enough. He didn't even want any money from us.

name: Place next to a river
description: The dirt road leads to a river in a valley where we felt save to camp. It was quiet and you'll find some picknick tables, too.

name: Camping Girele
description:
Not exactly a campsite.
It has a tarmac area with electrical hook up, mainly for campers and is all part of a hotel complex.
No kitchen but very nice log cabin with chairs and bathroom / shower and separate toilet for use if campers.
Wifi is good.

name: Trakai Island Castle
description: Trakai Island Castle (Lithuanian: Trakų salos pilis) is an island castle located in Trakai, Lithuania on an island in Lake Galvė. The construction of the stone castle was begun in the 14th century by Kęstutis, and around 1409 major works were completed by his son Vytautas the Great, who died in this castle in 1430. Trakai was one of the main centres of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania and the castle held great strategic importance.

name: The hill forts of Kernavė
description: Kernavė is the first capital of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania mentioned in historical chronicles (the second half of the 18th century). The hill forts of Kernavė are unique in the entire Baltic Sea region, as there are five on just one location. An impressive view of the turns of the Neris River, the island of the river and its banks open from it. The Archaeological and History Museum of Kernavė in which artefacts of the ancient times found during the excavations carried out in the course of several decades are collected, is also a location that attracts crowds at midsummer and on the Days of Living Archaeology in July, celebrating ancient crafts every year. During these Days masters of ancient arts from Lithuania and neighbouring countries – boot makers, potters, glaziers, jewellers, blacksmiths, furriers, beekeepers and others show their skills and sell their products. During the festival a demonstration medieval fights and concerts of ethnic music are held.

name: Pedestrian Bridge Over Širvena Lake
description: Širvėna Lake is the oldest artificial water body in Lithuania. In 1575, it came into existence following the building of a dam across two rivers running through Biržai for protection of both the fortress and the city. Stretched over a swampy area of nearly 400 hectares, the pond reliably protected the castle and the city from the north. Nowadays, the area of Širvėna Lake is around 325 hectares. Following the establishment of a linen factory in buildings of Astravas Manor in 1928, a 525-metre-long and 2.45-metre-wide footbridge has been built over Širvėna Lake to connect the Astravas Manor and the city of Biržai. It is the longest footbridge across a lake in Lithuania. Today, the footbridge is very popular with anglers and newlyweds, local people and visitors. It is a great place to admire views of the city, savour the calm tranquillity of the lake, and take a stroll to Astravas Manor.

name: The geographical Centre of Lithuania
description: Ruoščiai is a small village in Kėdainiai district municipality, Lithuania. Located about 3 km from Dotnuva, it had 37 residents according to the 2011 census. The settlement is known as the geographical center of Lithuania, which was calculated in 1995.

name: The Geographical center of Europe
description: Several countries claim to be at the heart of Europe, but according to the research of the French National Geographic Institute, the one and only geographical central point of the continent is in Lithuania, a fact that has even won recognition in the Guinness Book of World Records. In 1989, a group of French scientists from the institute announced that the geographical centre of Europe was just to the north of the Lithuanian capital Vilnius – 26 kilometres to be exact – near the village of Purnuškės.

name: Bikercamp Škilietai
description:
Biker camping Škilietai is located in a protected nature reserve area and sits between two Skilietai lakes. This unique location offers beautiful landscapes, stunning forests, and clean waters. With all that in mind, capital city Vilnius is only 50km (30mi) away!
Current campground capacity 40 is tents.

name: Paiešmeniai Camping
description: Nice place near VIA Baltica

name: Nidos Kempingas
description:
In the administrative Neringa town centre Nida, between Parnidis (Big) dune and the Baltic Sea, near the old gliders` school and stone age settlement of Five Hills, Nida campsite is located. It is only several hundred metres to the snow-white beaches, to the Sundial with the observation deck, to the centre of the settlement.

 Places under pine trees. Its a touristic place therefore crowded and more expensive. We paid 28€ (2 pax and camper).

name: Medaus Slėnis
description:
At the Honey Valley, we have adequate housing that includes a shower cabin, a TV, a bathroom and a kitchen available to our guests. The room rates are 10—20 €.. We have 4 rooms, 8 beds and a sauna.

Reservation is also available at booking.com

name: Parking next to lake
description: Parking space with small open cabin and benches. No facilities but nice open space in the woods close to a lake

name: Camping Mindūnai
description:
Mindunai Campsite provides excellent conditions for recreation, entertainment, water sports, and fishing. The camping has a parking area for campers with electricity and camper sewage and water refilling station. For those arriving with own boats, there is a special platform for lowering the boats into the water.
There are recreation zones with furniture and fire pits by the lake. Areas for tents and parking are available nearby.
The campsite has an administrative building with common areas: restrooms, showers, a laundry and a kitchen. There are 5 cosy buildings with all amenities on the first floor of the building. Free Wi-Fi is available in the administrative building and nearby. There are separate lodges for 6/8 people nearby, with a kitchen with crockery, a restroom, a shower, and a TV.
There is a sauna and a hot tub on the side of the lake for relaxing on long summer evenings. Those who like active recreation fill find a basketball and volleyball courts and a football fields to suit their needs. There is also a small playground for children on the campsite. The territory of the campsite is fenced, lit, and monitored by security cameras. There are kayaks, boats, bicycles, and more available for renting, firewood can also be purchased.
The Baltieji Latakai sightseeing tower is located nearby the campsite. Scenic views of the lake and the regional park open up from the top of the tower.

name: Kempingas Slenyje
description: Nice place close to a lake. Although the campsites are mostly without lake view.

name: Medaus  Slenis
description: Very nice campground with lots of green and small ponds. Relaxing surrounding. They sell exquisite Honey.

name: Kempingas Ventaine
description: Nice place with hotel and restaurant besides. However its a bit overpriced (5€ pP, 15€ for the Camper). And the showers are not in the best shape.

name: Lyduvėnai Bridge
description: The Lyduvėnai Railway Bridge (Lithuanian: Lyduvėnų tiltas) is one of the longest bridges in Lithuania. Total length 599 m

name: Camping / picnic spot
description: This is one of the many free camping and picknick spots around this lake. Mostly wth primitive wc, tables and fire place. some have space for bigger rigs

name: Ferry "Vilkynė"
description:
Ferry accross the river Nemunas

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=18tK4wyaSSg

name: Padaliai - Čiobiškis Ferry
description:
Seld-driving ferry accross the river Neris.

http://www.ciobiskiokeltas.lt/

name: Camping Papartis
description: The camping is basic but its situated marvellous. Near by a lake. We paid 25 € what is too much. Or: you pay about 10 € only for the beautiful landscape.

name: Mekšrinis lake campsite
description: A campsite managed and looked after by Dzūkijos national park administration. There is one main campground and a smaller campsite east of the lake. In the main campsite vehicles must be left at parking site and camping equipment carried by hand. In a smaller campsite it doesn't restrict you from coming with a vehicle, but you must obey the laws and park visiting rules which can be found on the web page. In Lithuania vehicles are not permitted parking closer than 25 meters from running or standing water source.

name: Camping Spot
description: There is a main spot with a shelter and fireplace and a small beach, which is frequented by locals. There are more spots down the path, which are more quiet.

name: Camping Spot
description: There is a main spot with a shelter and fireplace and a small beach, which is frequented by locals. There are more spots down the path, which are more quiet.

name: Apple Island
description:
Apple island is a modern four star recreational park and event venue on the island of the Lake Grabuostas. A place for undisturbed recreation in nature, as well as an exclusive venue for your personal or business events.

Apple island offers a modern four star camping site and wide range of recreational activities. Indoor and outdoor event spaces are available for your corporate or personal events, a conference or seminar, a birthday or a wedding. Our staff will be happy to assist you in making your event a success.

We welcome you to our restaurant with terrace overlooking the island for refreshments, a light snack or a delicious meal. For families our nearby playground enables you to keep an eye on your children, while enjoying our delicious food and drinks.

name: Aisetas
description:
Campground in the forest, near the lake Aisetas with a beautiful beach, equipped with fireplaces, tables with benches,
gazebo, outdoor toilet, trash bins.
  Rent of tourist and sports equipment: tents, kayaks, boats, bicycles, fishing equipment - echo fish finding, and other entertainment inventory.

name: Merkines NP campground
description: It’s an official campground designates by the National Park. There are toilets and benches. That’s all.

name: Marijampole
description:
Very nice place with Top Bath and a Lake fór Swimming. y
You can get electric power, running water and free WiFi. There is also a playground for Kids BBQ Stuff... If i remember right we payed for 2 motorcycles, 2 people and 2 tents not more than 20 € for one night.

name: national park designated campsite
description: Nice area with beach and benches. During daytime some local families visit

name: Grabučiškės
description: Very nice place, directly on bank of the lake. Very quiet. Good 4G/LTE coverage with Tele2.

name: Parking lot just before Ukmerge
description: Parking lot in front of some companies. Quiet at night.

name: Guest House - Nakvyne in Kalvarija
description: lovely place run by a charming man. Secured parking and just about a mile off the main road. He didn’t speak English but called his daughter, just as charming as her father. €15 for a night. Bargain. I would Highly recommend this place.

name: Campground and seating
description:
One of several campground in conjunction with neighbouring river.
There is a squat loo available on the location. 
There is a fire place and a covered seating area. Lots of space for tents, also a arranged parking space. Please use the parking space, don’t ruin the grass by driving on it. 

Water is clear and there is a small beach + barge to take a bath from. 

It’s a part of the trans euro trail (for motorcycles).

name: Baluosai
description:
It is a simple place next to the lake. There are little wooden tables, fireplaces and kind of pit toilets (but they are full). Bring a shovel. Some people before used to leave their garbage here.
The way to get there is nothing for a big camper. We were the only ones. It is free of charge.

name: Viešintas
description:
A very calm place next to the lake. There is an old small playground, a pit toilet and two fire places. It is free of charge. 
During the afternoon and early evening village people will go there for swimming or fishing. 
(In case it is rainy take care of mud when you use the place with heavy cars.)

name: Salotas
description: An informal place at the lake. Very quite. At the last house at the trail they explained as the way. You follow the trail till there is a broken break with a sign "private". Pass it. You will find fire places and tables. There is no way marked at Google Maps.

name: Girairiškių
description:
Wonderful, clean and calm place next to the river Nemunas. Official picnic place and nice fishing spot. Fire place, pit toilet, workout trail, tables available. 
Follow the track through the wood.

name: Mergakalnio
description: Viewpoint over the Sea with fireplaces and shelter with table and seats. Very quiet.

name: Europos Parkas
description:
Openair Museum with Sculptures from Artists over the hole World. The most is in the forest. Over 100 Exhibits.

Restaurant and WC available.

For a extra Charge of €10.00 you can Stay with your Car inside for the night

Entry : €9.00pP
Parking: €2.00/Car
Photo Permission: €1.50

name: Bukonys Camping
description: By far the calmest and cleanest camping we visited in the Baltikum. Very friendly lady welcomed us immediately with little English and lots of sign language. Perfect kitchen and fish ponds to swim in. However, with 25€ for a small van a bit pricey, but worth it.

name: Tauro Kalno Panorama
description:
Free overnight spot 18.00 - 08.00. During the day it's 0,3€/h (sunday free)
About 1km walking distance to the old town. The spot is next to a big Building (cafe) and a green parkarea. We parked here on a Friday and it got crowded and loud - so we parked behind the building where it was quiet.

name: Wisent Park (Bison's)
description: Nice Park with about 10 Wisents (European Bison). Worth a Visit. We camped on the parking Lot in Front of oft the Park. Very quiet here.

name: The Grey Dunes
description:
Dunes on the little strip connecting Kaliningrad and Latvia. 
For a Ford Ranger :
Ferry:28,30€
Park entry: 20€ 
Dune entry fee 2€ per person

Too much money for a touristy spot, where you can't see hardly anything of the dunes. Change my mind but I didn't like it here.

name: Trakiškio Campsite
description: Designated camp and recreation site near Ūla river. Couple of wooden benches with roofs, fireplaces, basketball and volleyball court, outhouse and litter station. Enough space for vehicles, no 4x4 requires. Stayed here in August and were complete alone. Very quiet and idyllic!

name: Valcu Nuoma, a place right at the lake
description: This is a place for campervans, looks like no tents, minimal infrastructure, pit toi only, but then right at the lake, 5min walk to the castle, we paid €10/night w/o power

name: into the wild
description: Nice, quiet and shady spot in the forest. Close to E47, but one can rarely hear it. No facilities but very peaceful.

name: camp ground established by local community
description: nice place to stay for picnic. there are some tables and benches

name: nice campsite by the lake
description: campsite with urban parking place for picnic

name: Rest Stop
description: a nice place to stay by the lake Asveja. Where you can stop for picnic, fishing or sightseeing. there is a hill across the bridge

name: Campgroung
description: one of campsites around lake Sartai where you can stop to have a rest

name: Vila Migla
description: Well built log house in Labanoras forest with the closed yard. Nearby fantastic clean lake Aisetas 16 km long. Drinkable water, WC, shower, fully equiped kitchen, bedroom with two double beds, internet inside the house. Free dry wood, grill place, warehouse in the yard. Suitable for up to four persons. Pets are allowed. The host is the producer of craft beer with the secondary fermentation in a bottle. Main atractions: berries, mushrooms, hiking, swimming, fishing, skiing, craft beer tasting.

name: Ineigos stovyklavietė
description: The campsite is located by the river Būka, next to the road Vaišniūnai - Šeimatis - Tauragnai. For the convenience of the visitors, the campsite is equipped with gazebos, outdoor tables with benches, fireplaces, outdoor toilets, footbridge, changing room, information stand and other infrastructure. The campsite is reachable by car.

name: Park Camp
description:
Beautiful lakeside, for tent, RVs and truck. simple toilet, BBQ and campfire places. staying for free!
Iveco 90-16

name: Viešintų poilsiavietė - Viešintai resort
description:
A very calm place next to the lake Viešintas. There is an playground for kids, a pit toilets, volleyball and basketball courts and several summerhouses including fireplaces. It is free of charge. 
There is a big parking place for cars.

name: Šaukiškiai pit
description: Nice place to stay near lake where was old pit. Several small lakes are located near village Šaukiškiai. Around these lakes you can easily find some more places to stay for a rest, picnic or night.

name: Liskiavio Krantas
description: Lovely spot, you need to cross an old ladies backyard, she asked €5 a night per person. There are covered places with benches and fireplaces. Spot is at a lake.

name: Camping Karkelbeck
description: Very nice camping with brand new facilities and nice owners. Just 500m from the sea. There is a warmed and covered kitchen where you can cook a meal or just sit when it’s cold. There’s a restaurant nearby.

name: Kurtuvenai camping
description: Very nice place with all facilities you need. Including a washingmachine and kitchen. There’s is a little shop en a restaurant nearby. Beautiful surroundings.

name: Kempingas Vilkoksnis
description: Nice campsite in national park at a lake with big fireplace, also cabins for rent. There is a kitchen.

name: Sabalunku stovyklaviete
description: a nice place to stay for picnic near lake Luodis. there is a fireplace, parking place for your car, shelter - all you need to have a rest in a nature

name: Memelburg
description: Good spot to visit the city which is a 5 minute walk away. 60 cents for 240 minutes.  we spent the night here.  There is also parking if you carry on past this spot towards the harbour.  The city is well worth a visit.

name: City Parking
description: Perfect spot to explore the city. Next to Kaunas castle. 60 cents for an hour.  Free parking between 18.00 and 08.00. No problem spending the night but it's very noisy.  Toilets 70m away. River and grassy area bordering the carpark.

name: Exhibition centre
description: Relatively quiet place at Litexpo.  Close to the river and nice area to walk the dog.

name: Stanka Lake
description: Nice little parking right next to the lake.

name: Parking on the beach
description:
Nice parking next to the beach. Quiet during the day and deserted at night.
Very clean toilets available.

name: Great NP campsite on Lake
description:
Berzynelis National Park campsite. Gorgeous open spot in the forest on the lake with benches and fire pits. Great access for swimming in the lake. Feels a bit off the beaten track with a few locals on the weekend. 
We had a lcoal guy pass by for Stand Up Paddle baord rental. Eur 8/hr/pp.

name: Hostel Chocolate
description: 12 euros on night with secured parking. hot shower fast Wi-Fi. Even some free tea. close to the downtown! a little bit cheaper if you booked through booking.com

name: Russian Bunker
description: super cool Bunker in the middle of nowhere. Probably able to camp hear but also able to go hiking and exploring.

name: Lookout Tower
description: really cool tower overlooking a swamp. Great to look at the sunset with the birds flying over the lakes. also possible to camp here in the parking lot more in the park.

name: Parking lot with sea access
description: Parking surrounded by a forest and with sea access (5min walk). Toilet open from 8am to 10pm. We slept two nights here with many other campers without any problem.

name: Filoria hostel
description: 8 Euros a night for a nice hostel with a kitchen as well as parking. beds a bit hard but definitely a nice place

name: cosy Beach next to a parking place
description: Right next to an overland road there is a small parking place next to the Memel. The Sandy Beach invites for a picknick. We camped there one night, directly next to the parking, but you can also go Further into the high grass and find some places to camp

name: parking as Alternative to camp
description: large parking space for all sorts of vehicles. in Main season campground can be Full. here you can buy a ticket for 3Euro 24hrs parking. good Alternative, of course not facilities.

name: SAULĖTEKIS camp
description: Nice camp at the lake. Nobody here. Have to call when arrival but no english.

name: Lakeside
description: Small lake with picnic table. Very quiet.

name: Lake Lukstas
description:
Small parking surrounded by forest, right next to a lake. Unfortunately lots of vegetation restricting the view of the lake. The place is very frequently visited by locals, mostly fishermen but also campers, all very friendly but as usual - quite loud during the weekends. Be sure to bring earplugs. :)
Good for one night.

name: Meadow next to campsite
description:
A large peaceful grassy meadow about 100m south of a small official (but free) campsite in the National Park. 
The campsite have firepits and tables/benches under a roof if you would choose to stay there. There is a new dirt road, which seems to end at the meadow. Couldn't find the new road on any maps 09/2019 but the old narrow forest road is fine for smaller 2WD, at least coming from the north. This campsite is as of today not necessarily suitable for bigger campers because of the narrow road in.

name: River Night
description: Grassy area direct at the river. There are some canoe tourists arriving here. Fisherspot in the morning. But no problem at all. Good for one night.

name: Post office parking
description: Very quiet. Away from the high road. Surrounded by trees lawn flowers. Flat. Nobody paid any attention to us.

name: By the river
description:
A small gravel road that leads past a watertreatmentplant (?) up to a WW2 memorial of the Jews in this area.
Decent place to stay with a view over the river, a few cars coming and going in the evening and night, a few fishermen around in the morning. Lots of noise from the busy main road nearby, ear plugs recommended.

name: Beach Tauragnai
description:
A nice spot next to a small lake.
There is a small beach with benches and a fireplace.

name: River spot
description: wild camping spot right at the river "Memel" ("Nemunas"), not that easy to find but it is awesome. #mannitalks

name: the awesome
description: a beautiful spot direct at a crystal clear lake close to an official camp site, table, seats and fireplace are available. The sign "private" just means that you have to pay approx. 7€ per night, you can continue the path and will find additional beautiful spots !

name: the shelter
description: beautiful spot close to a lake with a small beach, jetty, fireplace and shelter with tables and seats (electrical power available). #mannitalks

name: Kaunas reservoir forest
description:
A small playground at the lake. You can grill here, swim and enjoy the nature.
Families come here at the weekend.

name: Bugeniu poilsiaviete
description: Nice place, quait, for tent or camper. Hiking near river, childrens play ground.

name: Wake beach parking
description: There are beach, wake park, boat ramp, sport field

name: 4 parkas parking lot
description: Big parking, dogs carry walk zone, near lake and wake park, child carry place.

name: Skaistakalnio adventure park
description: Silent place for night near adventure park, some zio lines, childrens activitys, small lake and river, hiking track, 15min to town center.

name: Tiltas camp site
description: Nice, silent in low season place near river Šventoji. Pedestrian bridge, nice nature, some hiking possibilities, firewood.

name: Prigodo lake
description: Nice place near lake, fire place, pit toilet

name: Skaidrio lake campsite
description: Nice silent place, fireplace, clear lake, near road.

name: Zarasas lake view
description: Bridge with nice view, all season visitors object, coin toilet.

name: Lake Sartai free camp
description: Nice place, little windy, but silent. Some hiking tracks

name: Old train bridge
description: Nice place near river, nice view, historical bridge, fireplace

name: Beach
description: Nice place, sometimes windy, cross old reacreation base for find this place in South side Pervalka.

name: Preila village end
description: Quait place in the end of village. Hiking and bicycle track to Nida or Pervalka, small beach, alot birds.

name: Rambynas mount
description: Nice place, fireplace, near river Nemunas, border to Russia. Some hikings, quiet place.

name: Naftos dujos
description: No problem with refill all types of gas tanks

name: Raudone castle
description: Best place for night near river Nemunas. Hiking to castle Raudone, not so noisy from road, many spots for stay.

name: Oreivių užuovėja
description: Air baloon team village. Nice place, friendly owners with his history and hand made rooms.

name: Campsite near Auslas lake
description: Nice campsite with shelter on lakeside, few facilities. Contact +37067573934. We've paid low season price - 5 eur/person for staying in own tent.

name: Lake Luoka camping
description: A nice place to stay overnight or have a picnic near Luoka lake.

name: Wild camping near Akmena river
description: Nice place to stay near Akmena river where you enjoy listening to bird songs.

name: Gaveikenai camp
description: Free place near lake, a lot of spots woth fireplaces

name: Lake Dringis camping
description: Wild camping near lake Dringis for picnic or camping

name: Wind camping between lake Kretuonas and river Kretuonėlė
description: Wild camping between lake Kretuonas and river Kretuonėlė. There are several places for camping for your needs

name: Wild camping near Kretuonas lake
description: Wild camping near Kretuonas lake for picnic or camping. Great place to spend time in nature

name: Asalnų camp
description: Nice place, a lot of spots and fireplaces, children playing fields etc.

name: Kalviai camp ground
description: nice place to stay for picnic. There are some tables and benches with shelter by the pond. Kid's playground etc. Camp ground established by local community, but it's open for visitors.

name: Tauragnai Valley
description: Great place to stay near lake Tauragnas.

name: Čižiūnų vėjas
description: Safe, private area, for the night with a tent.

name: Svilės's springs
description: campsite near Svilės's springs where you can stay or have a picnic. Popular place as people are coming to get some fresh water.

name: Nevezis spot
description: Quait nice place near river Nevezis. Good place for one or two nights, clean water for swimmiing.

name: nice spot near the lake
description: Really nice spot, you can come with a car or anything else, you have 2 places near eatch other both really nice

name: Pauolia's forest trail
description:
Forest trail where you can walk in forest and take a rest or just stay for a picnic. More at:

https://nesedeknamuose.lt/pauolios-misko-takas-dar-neatrastas-bet-vertas-demesio/

name: Wild Camping in the Forest
description:
Located 10 km north of Darbenai. 500 meters from the highway.
A gravel road and then you turn right into the forest.
Some nice spots to sleep. Very quiet. Only 2 cars passed by on the track all night.

name: Countryside homestead "Šniūrai"
description:
Nice little campground on private land. The nice lady living in the house offers us a place to stay. Next to a lake. You can rent a boat, use a hot tub or sauna. 
One little house with two toilets and one shower. Washing machine and fridge is also there.

name: Walking park
description: Nice place for half hour, some birds, wooden sculptures, wc.

name: Kastinis lake
description: Nice spot next to the lake. Benches and a bit play garden for children. At the moment we were there, there were two other couples of overlanders. Swimming. Free.

name: Campground Vilnius City
description: For us ideal to fresh up. Water, clean toilets, emptying chemical toilet, washing machines, hot showers are available. Even electricity and fast WiFi. They call it a campsite, but it’s all on a former parking. We paid 22,00 euros for a night with two persons. All on tarmac. There were 12 others in high season. Not far from the city. The offer several tours to Trakai and Vilnius as well.

name: next to the river Memel
description:
On a small hill (old castle) you can build your tent with a beautiful view on the river. Fishermen are not far. A place for campfire, benches and a table are near
next to the hill you could park your van.

name: Kupiškis Lagoon
description:
Nice place near Kupiškis Lagoon.

There are several penthouses for picnic. Pit toilet and fireplaces.

name: Sodyba Ošupis Šventojoje
description:
Campsite on private ground. Expensive place!!!
24 Euro for one night (2Persons, small tent, car)
Good facilities, clean shower (only one for women and one for men), clean toilets, plus hair dryer for everyone. Big and clean kitchen. Little picnic huts all over the campsite.
5 minutes walk to Baltic sea and sandy beach.

name: Free Camping by the Nemunas River
description:
Some good spots to camp and sleep.
Just by the bridge of the Nemunas River.
Sandy beach. Some mosquitos but quiet at night.
Has pit fire places that some irresponsible people use to put garbage.
DON'T DO IT!!!
Has 2 pit toilets and a covered picnic table and benches.
You can even take a bath in the river.
Please keep the camping places clean.

name: Pragalvys
description: Nice place to stay next to small lake Pragalvys. Easy to find spot even for large campers. WC on site. Forest with some interesting stone sculptures nearby.

name: noble resort
description: nice place to stay. There are several shelters including pit toilets and fireplaces. Big parking space and playground for kids.

name: Druskininkai Camping
description: Fully equiped camping in the resort town of Druskininkai in southern Lithuania. Sites level, with e+w. Clean restrooms and showers. Small restaurant at the place. We payed 2 adults €19 pn, this includes the resort fee. D. is worth a visit, there are lots of spas. Close to D is Grutas Park, if you are interested in the soviet era. Shopping, cafes, all is close. Quiet.

name: Samanis lake
description:
Wild camping down the road along the coast of Samanis lake.

There are several places with benches and tables with fireplaces. Pit toilet is nearby.

name: Baidarės Anykščiuose
description: Place for camping or stay for a night. Owners are big fans of kayaking - you can rent a kayak and have great time in local rivers

name: Pajurio Kempingas - Camping by the sea
description: Proper camping which rents huts as well. Sites are with p+w. Good, clean restrooms and showers inside a solid building. There's a big kitchen, too and a room to eat your selfprepared meal. Terrain with lots of pine trees, shadow. Appr. 900 m walking distance to next beach. There's a train line nearby, so expect some noise. The camping itself is good and well kept; a nice lady in the reception. She speaks english well. We paid for 1 camper + 2 adults € 25.

name: Forest in front of Nemunas river
description: A nice spot in the forest, close to Kaunas, in front of Nemunas river. In this point, the river is enlarged so much that seems to be a lake. There are public tables and benches all around.

name: Sravinaitis camp
description: Nice place near lake, silent, clean, good road. See photos for prices

name: Lost Place tiny place for one small camper
description: A tiny spot for one camper only but super romantic in front of a lost place ruine

name: Happy Lake
description: Nice place on the river - quite and very beautiful.

name: Gamtos kišenėje
description: Milking sheeps (and more others animals) small farm "Nature pocket" is a unique place for relaxation, and for information about Lithuanian tradicional life in the farm. We can offer for you our green house or place for camper, car for your overnight stay in nature. A truly rustic Lithuanian breakfast, made from farm produce, awaits you. See you soon ?

name: Beach place
description: There are many wild camping spots in the river. This one is one of our favorite. It’s nice for swimming and although nice to have a bonfire here. The way is off road and only for small rigs or a sprinter.

name: Parking Spot on Ocean side
description:
Nice parking spot on the ocean side of the island.
50m to the beach.

name: Fairytale Camp
description: Extremely beautiful official campsite for free. Situated in the forest right next to a lake. One of the nicest spots we've camped so far in Europe.

name: Arzuolupiai
description: A Lake with swimming place + parking and allowed camping. Basic toilets without water

name: Genys Camping
description: A nice official campground. Swimming place, lavatories, kitchen, tables and chairs. Welcoming owner. We paid 24€ for 4 people, 2 tents.

name: Kintai
description: A swimming place equipped with a bird observation tower, benches, pit toilet and rubbish container. Informal campsite: caravans and mobile homes stay there.

name: Place next to Tower of Labūnava Manor
description:
A bit off the busy street, tent can be put behind some trees. 
There is a Tower Monument which can be visited, but not very popular therefore we did not encounter anyone.

name: Beautiful spot at the lake
description:
Small half-Island with lots of room for tents and a small picnic bench

beautiful view of the sunset

the entry is blocked by big boulders, we were just able to squeeze through on medium size motorbikes, boxers might be too wide.

(big) rigs can park just before the boulders (see second picture)

in the morning, some fishermen came to the island but they did not mind (and did not speak any English)

name: Londris
description: Very clean laundromat with 4 good sized washing machines, 4 dryers and one extra large dryer. Payment is by the Londris app or using the touchscreen in the laundromat with a credit card. Soap is available for purchase as well. Washer costs 2.95 and regular size dryers are 3.50; extra large dryer is 4.75. There is no Wi-Fi,  no power sockets,  no attendant.

name: Camping at a lake
description:
The camping ground is very spacious, fits several tents and smaller campervans. There are showers and toilets, a football field and a water tap with water for dishwashing etc.
We were 2 people and paid 15€ for a small car and a tent for one night. The owners live close by, are very friendly and speak english.
The campsite is very clean, the showers and toilets are not the newest but seem to be cleaned regularly and are in a relatively good and clean condition. Hot water for showering available.
There is a lake just across the road where you can swim, and not far away (300m maybe) is a resort with a lakeside beach, a volleyball court and more space for sitting and enjoying the view. 
Road to get to the camping ground is not paved but still well accessible, we've seen people with a camper there so - should work :)

name: Lake of Tytuvėnai
description: Lake with plenty of space and trees for going Wil d camping. The lake is very beautiful with a wake park and beach volley field. There are people swimming in summer period till late. Good and free Wi-Fi and charging point for electronics devices.

name: Park in Rokiskis
description: We camped in the big park with our tent and it was no problem at all for the locals.

name: Mazikle
description: Rest area in park next to a lake. Camping was not a problem at all

name: Šuneliškių Ravas
description:
Nice place on the shore of the Kaunas sea (Memel). In the evening there were some fishermen, but they didn't care about our tent. Very nice sunset! :) 

Cars can only park at the parking lot closeby.

name: Next to Memel river
description: Camping space next to Memel river. Some fishermen around, but no problems! :)

name: Rambyno Miškas
description: Very nice view point next to Russian border. Stairs goes down to Memel river. Very nice sunset!

name: Karkles kopos
description:
Lovely small campsite,very relaxed, nice owner and good facilities. 
Free WiFi.

name: meodow 2 / watchtower
description:
i was looking for the place next to the meadow.

did not find it.

but found this place next to the watchtower.

buitifull landscape.
really quit.

a lot of birds.

name: Great place for free camping
description:
Fitted place with fire place, picnic table, bench and dry toilet... All around a superb lake. 
There are two water access pontoons. 
All in self-service. 
Please leave the place so clean : there are trash cans for that. 
We were there on a Monday there was no one

name: next to the lake
description:
At the end of the path there is a small beach with benches and a fire place.  we were there on a Tuesday it was super quiet. 
point of vigilance the water is a little cloudy remember to filter it if necessary

name: free camping spot
description: Free camping place with picnic table, place of fire and access to the lake.  There are also dry toilets the place is great possibility of finding a quiet place even on weekends

name: Čižiūnų vėjas
description: Safe, private place, overnight with a tent

name: Quiet Parking in the center of Vilnius
description:
Parking spot right in the center. You Can stay overnight. 
0,7 euro/hour. The place is secured with camera surveillance. 
No toilet, water or electricity

name: Hill of the crosses
description: Manifesto of the Lithuanians on their freedom of religion, under the oppression of the USSR.

name: Free parking
description: Close to Klaipeda, North battery and Amber beach.

name: trailhead parking spot
description: Parking lot at the trailhead. Picnic tables, fireplace, pit toilet. Nice view of the lagoon. Several small camping cars were there staying overnight with us. Tents are not allowed though.

name: Šlavanto
description:
One of the few free public campsites in this area. Beautiful view over the lake, the campsite is a bit secluded from the lake shore. Picknick benches, fireplaces, long drop toilet. Unfortunately with the usual rubbish. 

Navigation may not take you to the right place. To get here, take the forest track that branches off the road heading northeast from Gudeliai, 400m after the intersection with road 134 (54.153896, 23.620136).

name: Zeimelis Wild Camping
description: Nice place near small lake. Park free. No showers or electricity, there is a toilet.

name: Molėtai Campsite
description: Small free campsite with a decent cell signal

name: Gauštvinio stovyklavietė
description: Very quiet place, in the middle of the countryside, picnic area.

name: Camping near forest road
description: A spot in the middle of the forest next to a quiet forest road.
